revised_title: Anatomical Study of a Child Born Without a Brain
tldr: A child was born without a brain, and an anatomical study was conducted to understand the situation. The child's skull was found to be malformed, with no parietal bones and a missing upper part of the occipital bone. No brain or dura mater was found, and the nerves were found to be in their natural order. The child's eyes, face, and other parts were found to be natural, and the tongue and throat were in good condition. The cause of the child's survival and movement without a brain remains a mystery.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
